statement.p: In the model \displaystyle{A}={1840}\cdot{\left({2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{38}}}}\right)} what is the percent increase or decrease?
Note all numbers are scientific measurements.

solution.p: The percent increase/decrease is calculated from \displaystyle{2}^{{\frac{{1}}{{38}}}}\approx{1.0184080932741}. Because this is bigger than 1, this is a percent increase and the result is \displaystyle{1.0184080932741}-{1}={0.018408093274102}\approx{0.018} and the percent is 1.8.
We round to 2 significant digits because the measurement (exponent) had 2 significant digits.
